business.headline: India-EU trade deal: What FTA may change for goods, services and your costsConsumers can expect cheaper European cars, more affordable electronics and smoother services access as India and the European Union prepare to officially announce the conclusion of negotiations on their long-awaited free trade deal.

Why Sensex, Nifty fell today despite India-EU trade deal announcement?Sensex fell more than 400 points in early trade, while the Nifty dropped close to 100 points. However, both indices recovered part of the losses and were trading higher by around 9:40 am. Despite this recovery, the overall mood on the Street remained cautious.
Sensex, Nifty open lower despite India-EU trade deal hopes; RIL down 1%The S&P BSE Sensex was down 393.37 points to 81,144.33, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 96.65 points to 24,952.00 as of 9:30 am.

Gold, silver reach record highs. Check gold and silver rates in your cityGold futures jumped over 1.7% to hit a record high of Rs 159,820 per 10 grams. Silver futures saw an even sharper move, rising around 6% to touch a record high of Rs 354,780 per kg.

Sensex, Nifty today: Stock market likely to open higher. Here's whyGift Nifty futures were trading at 25,187 at around 8:30 AM. This suggests that the Nifty 50 may open above its previous close of 25,048.65 recorded on Friday. Stock markets were closed on Monday due to the Republic Day holiday.

EU–India FTA: Will the mother of all trade deals be announced today?Senior EU leaders have described the proposed agreement as one of the biggest and most complex trade deals the bloc has ever attempted, with some calling it the "mother of all deals".

Live: India-EU FTA will strengthen shared commitment to rule of law, says PM ModiIndia EU Trade Deal Live Updates: After nearly two decades of negotiations, India and the European Union are all set to announce their historic trade deal on January 27 at the 16th India-EU summit. The summit will be co-chaired by the President of the European Council, Antonio Luis Santos da Costa, and the President of the European Commission, Ursula von der Leyen, who are presently on a state visit and attended India's 77th Republic Day ceremony as chief guests. The deal will bring both parties closer together, with active cooperation on trade, security, and the clean energy transition. Catch all the live updates at indiatoday.in.

India, Russia trade on track for $100 billion by 2030 amid crude surge: AmbassadorIndia and Russia are confidently working towards a $100 billion bilateral trade target by 2030. Increased trade in national currencies and new agreements hint at stronger economic ties ahead.

Lower auto tariffs, wider market access: What the India-EU trade deal may look likeIndia-European Union trade negotiations have reached a decisive stage, with New Delhi offering major tariff cuts on European cars and both sides signalling readiness to seal a politically significant deal that could reshape trade, investment and supply chains.
India plans to cut EU car tariffs to 40% from 110% ahead of trade deal: ReportThe anticipated tariff cuts would substantially ease access to the Indian market for Volkswagen, Mercedes-Benz and BMW.

IndiGo cancels flights to Tbilisi, Tashkent, Baku till Jan 28 amid Iran tensionsIn view of the prevailing situation and after careful assessment, IndiGo said it was cancelling flights to and from Tbilisi (Georgia), Almaty (Kazakhstan), Tashkent (Uzbekistan) and Baku (Azerbaijan) on January 26, 27 and 28.

India, EU mega trade deal near finish line with phased tariff cuts: Maros SefcovicAutomobiles have long been one of the toughest chapters in the India–EU free trade negotiations. European carmakers have sought lower import duties and clearer rules to expand their footprint in India, while New Delhi has remained cautious, wary of exposing domestic manufacturers to sudden competition.

India set to become 3rd-largest economy, but why is per capita income still low?Every time India moves up the global GDP ranks, the per capita income question resurfaces. Looking at both together shows a truer picture than letting one overshadow the other.

Explained: Why EU leaders' India visit matters for the mega trade dealBy linking one of the world's fastest-growing major economies with a bloc that remains a central pillar of global trade, the deal would reshape supply-chain flows at a time when governments are rethinking their economic dependencies.

IndiGo's 10% flight curbs kick in, Centre redistributes slots to airlinesIndia's aviation sector is witnessing a strategic reshuffle as the government redistributes 10 per cent of IndiGo's flight operations to other domestic carriers. This phased approach aims to balance capacity while ensuring passenger convenience and connectivity.

Why most Indians are still underinsured despite buying insuranceSeveral insurer-backed studies show that a large share of Indian policyholders have life cover of less than five times their annual income. Most financial planners recommend at least 10 to 15 times annual income, and often more.

Will AI kill jobs across the globe and how can India ride the AI wave? Experts weigh inIn this India Today special show from the World Economic Forum in Davos, top artificial intelligence innovators share their perspectives on the global AI race, AI's impact on the Indian economy and much more.

From income protection to easier credit: What gig workers expect from Budget 2026Delivery partners, drivers and freelancers form the backbone of India's fast-growing gig economy, yet financial security remains fragile for many. As Budget 2026 approaches, gig workers are hoping for measures that offer income protection, smoother credit access and faster support during emergencies.

Gold shines at record highs: What should investors do now?With gold touching new lifetime highs, the metal has once again proved its role as a refuge in uncertain times. But for investors, the rally raises a key question: what is the right move at current levels? Let's have a look.

Are personal loans becoming the go-to option during medical emergencies?A sudden medical emergency can quickly turn into a financial crisis. With healthcare costs rising and insurance cover often falling short, many Indian families are increasingly turning to personal loans to bridge the gap.

entertainment.headline: Vijay's Jana Nayagan faces setback, court pauses order granting censor certificate The Madras High Court has set aside a single-judge order granting censor clearance to Jana Nayagan and sent the case back for a fresh hearing.

Sara Ali Khan and Orry's friendship reportedly hits a roadblock: How did it start? The public fallout between Sara Ali Khan and Orry began after a series of controversial comments on social media. The posts drew heavy criticism online and sparked fresh debate about limits and behaviour in influencer culture.

Randeep Hooda's wife Lin Laishram's baby shower blends tradition, fun and games Actors Lin Laishram and Randeep Hooda, who are expecting their first child, hosted an intimate baby shower celebration, and pictures from the event have surfaced online.

Bella Hadid, boyfriend Adan Banuelos split after dating for two years: Report Supermodel Bella Hadid and professional rodeo star Adan Banuelos have reportedly ended their relationship after over two years. Neither has publicly commented, but reports indicate the split occurred in January 2026.

Ranbir Kapoor shares big update on Animal Park shoot Ranbir Kapoor recently provided updates on his highly-anticipated film 'Animal Park', the sequel to the 2023 film 'Animal'. The actor indicated that production is scheduled to begin in 2027.

Singer Chinmayi counters Chiranjeevi's denial of casting couch in Telugu cinema Singer Chinmayi Sripaada has publicly reacted to veteran actor Chiranjeevi's recent comments dismissing the existence of casting couch practices in the Telugu industry. Sharing her experiences and those of other women, Chinmayi has highlighted ongoing issues of harassment and exploitation.

Border 2 box office Day 4: Big Republic Day boost for Sunny Deol starrer Sunny Deol's action-packed film Border 2 continued its blockbuster run on Monday as it saw a major boost during the Republic Day holiday. Strong audience response and festive footfalls kept the film buzzing at the box office.

Ranabaali: Vijay Deverakonda, Rashmika Mandanna's new film gets title, release date The makers of Ranabaali have released an intense first glimpse of the upcoming period action drama, starring Vijay Deverakonda and Rashmika Mandanna. Directed by Rahul Sankrityan, the film is set to release globally this year.

DJ Snake calls off India tour, cites health issues: Incredibly hard decision French EDM artist DJ Snake has cancelled his anticipated Sunburn Arena tour across six Indian cities due to health concerns requiring surgery. The tour was scheduled for February.

Nikki Tamboli reveals why she initially said no to The 50. Exclusive Actor Nikki Tamboli revealed in an exclusive interview why she initially said no to The 50 and what finally convinced her to join the reality show. She also opened up about the fan-first format, her partnership with Arbaz Patel, and the Rs 50-lakh prize twist.

Kanye West links antisemitic remarks to bipolar struggles, issues rare apology Rapper Kanye West apologised for the harm caused by his antisemitic remarks and erratic behaviour. He linked his actions to untreated bipolar disorder and past health issues.

Beckham family in Paris amid family feud as Victoria receives top French honour The Beckham family reunited publicly in Paris to support Victoria Beckham as she was honoured by the French Ministry of Culture during Haute Couture Fashion Week. The appearance marked a significant moment amid recent reports of family tensions involving their eldest son, Brooklyn Beckham.

I still have a lot to learn: Zubin Mehta tells Rajdeep Sardesai Music icon and Padma Vibhushan recipient Zubin Mehta is the first guest on Rajdeep Sardesai's series, The Legends. Music apart, he spoke of his pride for India, his Parsi identity and emotions for Mumbai.

Video: Sydney Sweeney climbs Hollywood sign for lingerie promo, may face charges Sydney Sweeney was seen scaling the iconic Hollywood sign late at night, dressed in black cargo pants, a hoodie and a cap. Once atop the structure, she appeared to decorate the California landmark by stringing a clothesline of bras across the famous letters as the stunt was filmed.

Republic Day 2026: Saira Banu remembers Dilip Kumar's belief in India's humanity Saira Banu marked India's 77th Republic Day with a note, saying the occasion is a feeling rooted in humanity, not just a date. She also paid tribute to Dilip Kumar's belief that India's true soul lives in its people's kindness and compassion.

Shriya Saran calls Space Gen Chandrayaan Nakul Mehta's finest performance yet Shriya Saran called Space Gen Chandrayaan a tribute to the unsung heroes behind historic achievements, highlighting the responsibility and emotional depth of the series.

Varun Dhawan's Metro pull-ups video goes viral, authorities issue advisory Varun Dhawan went viral after being seen doing pull-ups inside a Mumbai Metro coach while heading to a surprise theatre visit amid Border 2 success. The Mumbai Metro authorities responded with a safety advisory, reminding commuters to follow travel rules.

Salman Khan spends Republic Day with niece and nephew, listens to Maatrubhoomi Salman Khan marked Republic Day by sharing a tender moment with niece Ayat and nephew Ahil as they listened to Battle of Galwan's patriotic song "Maatrubhoomi".

Scale is so big: Border 2 director Anurag Singh on challenge of shooting the film Director Anurag Singh revealed the massive scale and technical challenges behind Border 2, which was largely shot on real locations to maintain authenticity.

general news.headline: Live: India-EU FTA will strengthen shared commitment to rule of law, says PM ModiIndia EU Trade Deal Live Updates: After nearly two decades of negotiations, India and the European Union are all set to announce their historic trade deal on January 27 at the 16th India-EU summit. The summit will be co-chaired by the President of the European Council, Antonio Luis Santos da Costa, and the President of the European Commission, Ursula von der Leyen, who are presently on a state visit and attended India's 77th Republic Day ceremony as chief guests. The deal will bring both parties closer together, with active cooperation on trade, security, and the clean energy transition. Catch all the live updates at indiatoday.in.

Vijay's Jana Nayagan faces setback, court pauses order granting censor certificateThe Madras High Court has set aside a single-judge order granting censor clearance to Jana Nayagan and sent the case back for a fresh hearing.

India, EU finalise talks for 'mother of all deals', pact to be announced today  Live UpdatesIndia and the European Union have concluded negotiations on a comprehensive free trade agreement after nearly 20 years. The pact is set to enhance trade, reduce tariffs, and strengthen strategic partnerships amid shifting global trade dynamics.

UGC row: Your cheat sheet to controversy over new guidelinesThe University Grants Commission (UGC) has notified a new set of regulations aimed at addressing discrimination in higher education institutions across India.

India helped Bangladesh weave a success story. It'll now fight it out in EuropeIndia didn't just help Bangladesh in its 1971 Liberation War but supported it throughout its development journey. India helped Bangladesh build the ready-made garments sector, which helped pull millions out of poverty. Some say India sacrificed its own textiles industry for that. Now, that very sector will see competition from Indian exports, especially in the European markets.

US strike on Iran imminent? Aircraft carrier, warships arrive in Middle EastThe US Navy's Abraham Lincoln carrier strike group has entered the Middle East waters amid rising tensions with Iran. This deployment brought fresh speculation that US President Donald Trump could order airstrikes on Tehran.

Meta can read private WhatsApp chats, claims lawsuit; company calls it absurdWhile the plaintiffs have called WhatsApp's end-to-end encryption feature a "sham," Meta has dismissed the allegations as "false and absurd."

Bengaluru man hangs on to friend's car after spat, dies after vehicle crashesThe dispute, which reportedly escalated after the two had been drinking, turned fatal when the victim tried to stop the vehicle by holding onto its door, with the driver allegedly crashing into a tree while driving rashly.

Sara Ali Khan and Orry's friendship reportedly hits a roadblock: How did it start?The public fallout between Sara Ali Khan and Orry began after a series of controversial comments on social media. The posts drew heavy criticism online and sparked fresh debate about limits and behaviour in influencer culture.

Border 2 box office Day 4: Big Republic Day boost for Sunny Deol starrerSunny Deol's action-packed film Border 2 continued its blockbuster run on Monday as it saw a major boost during the Republic Day holiday. Strong audience response and festive footfalls kept the film buzzing at the box office.

Ex-IAF chief explains why India fielded MiG-21 vs Pak F-16 during Balakot dogfightDuring the 2019 Balkot dogfight, Wing Commander Abhinandan Varthaman's MiG-21 Bison was shot down, leading many to wonder whether deploying the MiGs during the dogfight was a sound decision.

India-EU trade deal: What FTA may change for goods, services and your costsConsumers can expect cheaper European cars, more affordable electronics and smoother services access as India and the European Union prepare to officially announce the conclusion of negotiations on their long-awaited free trade deal.

Beckham family in Paris amid family feud as Victoria receives top French honourThe Beckham family reunited publicly in Paris to support Victoria Beckham as she was honoured by the French Ministry of Culture during Haute Couture Fashion Week. The appearance marked a significant moment amid recent reports of family tensions involving their eldest son, Brooklyn Beckham.
University of Bath School of Management announces up to £3 million in scholarships, empowering future global leadersStrategic Scholarship Investment Aimed at Attracting Exceptional Talent Worldwide

India roasts Pak at UN over Op Sindoor claims: Called us, pleaded for ceasefirePermanent Representative of India to the United Nations, Parvathaneni Harish, blasted Pakistan at the UN, saying the neighbouring nation's only agenda was to "harm my country and my people". He also refuted Pakistan's Operation Sindoor claims, calling them "false and self-serving".

Sunita Williams tried falooda in Kerala and loved it of course. Watch videoSunita Williams, the celebrated astronaut, visited a popular falooda store in Kozhikode, and a video of her warm interaction and enjoyment of the dessert charmed locals and social media alike.
Everyone's talking about the carnivore diet. But is it realistic in India?While social media is obsessing over the carnivore diet, one can't help but wonder if it fits the Indian plate.

Miami University: A Top U.S. Destination for Future Tech and Engineering LeadersMiami University Expands Opportunities for International Students Through Industry-Integrated Computer Science & Engineering Programs

Europe funding war against itself: Top Trump aide on India-EU trade dealUS Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent defended the Trump administration's decision to impose steep tariffs on Indian goods, arguing that European governments are undermining their own security stance through continued energy trade.

Sorry folks, India are the team to beat and rest are just spectators in T20 World CupIndia blew away New Zealand to secure another T20I series with a thumping win in Guwahati. With that the Indian team has sent the loudest message that the T20 World Cup 2026 is their title to lose.

Kanye West links antisemitic remarks to bipolar struggles, issues rare apologyRapper Kanye West apologised for the harm caused by his antisemitic remarks and erratic behaviour. He linked his actions to untreated bipolar disorder and past health issues.

Why nihilist penguin's 'death march' feels uncomfortably relatableHandcrafted ByOur Editors Meet the nihilist penguin: the little bird that broke ranks, walked away from the colony, and stole the internet's heart without saying a word. In a world obsessed with productivity, connection, and "having a plan," this penguin did the unthinkable: it just left. But why has a penguin's quiet departure resonated so widely?

UGC row deepens: Bureaucrat quits, BJP leader resigns, minister evades mediaThe new UGC guidelines have triggered protests across states, with anger now spilling into the administration and political ranks as resignations begin to follow.

Student misses exam due to train delay, gets Rs 9 lakh compensation from RailwaysA student approached the district consumer commission after she was unable to appear for her BSc Biotechnology entrance examination in 2018 due to the delayed arrival of an intercity superfast train. After a legal battle spanning over seven years, the commission ruled in her favour.

sports.headline: India should continue to back Sanju Samson: Rahane's advice for struggling opener Ajinkya Rahane has urged India to continue backing Sanju Samson despite his lean run in the T20I series. The former batter stressed belief, freedom and patience as key during the World Cup build-up.

MS Dhoni shares wisdom with youngsters at Jharkhand nets, begins IPL preparations MS Dhoni was spotted training with youngsters at the JSCA International Cricket Stadium in Ranchi. He also guided the emerging talent, sharing his experiences with them.

Former FIFA President joins World Cup boycott calls, urges fans to stay away from USA Former FIFA president Sepp Blatter has backed boycott calls, urging fans to avoid the USA during the 2026 World Cup. He cites security, civil rights, travel bans and immigration enforcement concerns surrounding tournament hosts now.

Australian Open: Dominant Sabalenka marmalises teenager Jovic to reach semis Aryna Sabalenka defeated 18-year-old Iva Jovic 6-3, 6-0 to reach the Australian Open semi-finals. She will next face either Coco Gauff or Elina Svitolina in the semi final.

Sorry folks, India are the team to beat and rest are just spectators in T20 World Cup India blew away New Zealand to secure another T20I series with a thumping win in Guwahati. With that the Indian team has sent the loudest message that the T20 World Cup 2026 is their title to lose.

ICC sidelined Bangladesh's legitimate security concerns: Ex Pakistan cricketer Mohammad Yousuf has strongly criticised the ICC for removing Bangladesh from the T20 World Cup 2026 and replacing them with Scotland. He feels that the decision has raised concerns over governance and fairness within international cricket.

Sanju Samson paradox: Should India hold firm or roll the dice as T20 World Cup nears As the T20 World Cup 2026 approaches, India must decide whether to persist with Sanju Samson at the top or rethink their opening plans in search of form, clarity and stability.

After making surprise entry, Scotland announce T20 World Cup 2026 squad Scotland have named a 15-man men's squad led by Richie Berrington, featuring George Munsey, Brandon McMullen and Safyaan Sharif, with travelling and non-travelling reserves added for depth.

Day 10 Live Updates: Zverev wins Set 3 vs Tien, Sabalenka into semifinals Australian Open, Day 10 Live Updates: Learner Tien has made a sensational turnaround by winning Set 2 vs Alexander Zverev via an intense tiebreaker, as the Rod Laver Arena are locked in a breathless, end-to-end Australian Open quarter-final. Earlier, Aryna Sabalenka stormed into the semi-finals with a dominant 6–3, 6–0 win over Iva Jovic.

Cricket Scotland chief expresses sympathy for Bangladesh after T20 World Cup entry Cricket Scotland's chief executive, Trudy Lindblade, expressed sympathy for Bangladesh following their withdrawal from the T20 World Cup 2026 due to security concerns in India. Scotland had replaced Bangladesh in Group C for the mega event.

IND vs NZ, New Zealand make notable squad changes to hit back after India's hammering New Zealand added Jimmy Neesham, Lockie Ferguson and Tim Seifert to their T20I squad in India, while Finn Allen will join for the final match, with India already leading the series 3-0.

ISL tipped to return on February 14, to kick-off with Mohun Bagan vs Kerala BlastersMohun Bagan Super Giant will open the ISL 2025-26 season against Kerala Blasters on February 14, while the Kolkata derby against East Bengal is scheduled for May 3, as per tentative fixtures released by the AIFF.

Richa's heroics in vain as Sciver-Brunt's special night keeps MI alive in playoffs raceNat Sciver-Brunt became the first player to score a century in the Women's Premier League. Her innings propelled Mumbai Indians to a commanding 50-run victory over Royal Challengers Bengaluru, keeping their playoff hopes alive.

Linkin Park's Emily Armstrong flaunts Indian cricket jersey, powers electric showEmily Armstrong wore the Indian cricket jersey and lit up Linkin Park's long-awaited Bengaluru debut, as a 40,000-strong crowd witnessed a historic, high-octane show blending classic anthems with new-era energy.

Nat Sciver-Brunt lights up Vadodara with historic first-ever century in WPLWPL 2026, RCB vs MI: Nat Sciver-Brunt became the first batter to score a hundred in the history of the tournament Mumbai Indians locked horns with Royal Challengers Bengaluru on Monday in Vadodara.

Ranji Trophy: Padikkal named Karnataka captain, KL Rahul returns for Punjab clashDevdutt Padikkal has replaced Mayank Agarwal as Karnataka's captain for their final league-stage Ranji Trophy match against Punjab.

Bangladesh's cricket crisis deepens with U19 World Cup exit after senior's T20 WC snubBangladesh U19 have been knocked out of the U19 World Cup after England beat them by seven wickets in the Super Sixes match on Monday in Bulawayo. Earlier, the senior men's team was left out of the T20 World Cup with Scotland replacing them.

Shai Hope to lead as West Indies name strong squad for T20 World CupThe West Indies have named a strong 15-member squad for the upcoming T20 World Cup 2026, with the two-time champions set to be led by Shai Hope at the ICC tournament.

Ishan Kishan's audacious intent receives big praise from R Ashwin: Different breedIND vs NZ: Ravichandran Ashwin praised Ishan Kishan's fearless batting after his rapid 28 off 13 balls against New Zealand, saying the left-hander's audacity and confidence showed a different breed of cricketer.

RCB vs MI Highlights: Richa's fireworks in vain as Mumbai Indians win by 15 runsRoyal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) vs Mumbai Indians (MI), WPL 2026 Highlights: Vadodara witnessed a high-scoring thriller as Mumbai Indians stay in contention for a spot in the play-offs with a 15-run win over the Royal Challengers Bengaluru.

Sabalenka, Alcaraz headline star-studded quarterfinal lineupAustralian Open: Aryna Sabalenka, Iga Swiatek, Carlos Alcaraz, Jannik Sinner and several other top contenders will be chasing places in the semifinals when they take the court in their respective quarterfinal matches.

India wanted Bangladesh in T20 World Cup but Pakistan misled them: Rajeev ShuklaBCCI vice-president Rajeev Shukla accused Pakistan of instigating Bangladesh after it refused to play T20 World Cup 2026 matches in India, leading to ICC rejecting venue changes and Scotland replacing Bangladesh.

Pakistan delay final call on T20 World Cup participation after PCB chief meets Pak PMThe Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) has delayed a final decision on the country's participation in the T20 World Cup after chairman Mohsin Naqvi met Prime Minister Muhammad Shehbaz Sharif.

Tilak Varma is a big-match player, knock vs Pakistan was unbelievable: Rohit SharmaTilak Varma has firmly established himself as a big-match player, delivering consistent performances for Mumbai Indians and India, including a match-winning 69* in the Asia Cup 2025 final against Pakistan.

Don Bradman's Australia Baggy Green fetches whopping 460,000 dollars in auctionSir Donald Bradman's rare Baggy Green cap from the 1947–48 season sold for a record 460,000 dollars at auction, underscoring the enduring legacy and unmatched cultural value of cricket's greatest icon.

After ICC warning, Pakistan consider forfeiting India game at T20 World Cup: ReportT20 World Cup 2026: Pakistan are reportedly weighing its options to protest against the ICC, which includes forfeiting its game against India. This comes after the ICC's decision to not change the venues of Bangladesh's fixtures in the tournament.

Bihar thrash Manipur by 568 runs to secure Ranji Trophy Elite Group promotionBihar rode on opener Piyush Singh's outstanding second-innings double century to thrash Manipur by 568 runs in the Plate final on Monday, sealing their return to the Ranji Trophy Elite Group.

Iga Swiatek emulates Serena Williams, youngest in 23 years to reach major landmarkAustralian Open: World No.2 Iga Swiatek beat Maddison Inglis on Sunday at the Rod Laver Arena and advanced to the quarterfinals where she will lock horns with Elena Rybakina.

Sinner beats fellow Italian to storm into quarters after tracker controversyWorld number two Jannik Sinner was dominant in the shorter exchanges as he defeated Italian compatriot Luciano Darderi 6-1, 6-3, 7-6 (2) to book his place in the Australian Open quarter-finals.

Australian Open: Yuki Bhambri's exit brings down curtains on India's challengeYuki Bhambri and Andre Goransson were eliminated in the third round of Australian Open men's doubles. Their defeat ends India's participation in this year's Grand Slam tournament and raises concerns for Indian tennis prospects.

IND vs NZ: Tilak Varma to miss last two T20Is as BCCI makes T20 World Cup callIND vs NZ: Tilak Varma has been ruled out of the last two T20Is of the ongoing series against New Zealand as he continues his recovery from abdomen injury. Varma will link up with the Indian squad on February 3 ahead of their first warm-up fixture of the T20 World Cup 2026.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
